[Gratiolet (Anatomie comparee du Systeme 
Nerveux pp 174-178) seems to have been highly 
struck with Foville’s <s>[text?]<\s> dissections and from 
similar dissections made by himself on the 
brains of different animals he <s>has<\s> arrived 
at <s>very like <\s> much the same conclusions 
[He affirms <s>writes <\s> at p. 176 (loc. cit.) that there are two 
possibilities in regard to the structure of the 
corpus callosum “According to the first one 
can conceive that there are two sets of fibres 
in the corpus callosum. The first would be 
formed by the arching fibres resulting from the
anastomosis between the two coronae radiatae.
The second comprises fibres wh: are mixed 
<s>with <\s> but are not continuous with the first,
and wh: run directly between one hemisphere &
another.
[The second hypothesis is the following:- that 
one can conceive that the corpus callosum 
results from the intercrossing of certain fibres 
passing <s>to<\s> from each corona radiata to the opposite 
hemisphere above the cerebral ventricles. <s>This 
is diff <\s> made difficult to establish on account 
of the parallelism of the fibres intercrossing above the 
ventricular system.”
[Thus it is perfectly clear that although a good 
deal of what has been stated <s>affirmed <\s> by these
